Even though it was delivery, it was a very Italian experience. From the person who took my order to the marinated olives I had as an appetizer, you can tell this place has some authenticity. 5 of 5 for being a great delivery option; prompt delivery, hot food, good food, and courteous staff. I hope I get the opportunity to visit in person! 

I had the assorted olives as an appetizer, a small side salad w/poppyseed dressing, and the vegetable lasagna for an entree. The salad was a typical garden salad, but was very fresh. The dressing was also very good. My lasagna was awesome. All food arrived hot (salad was cold & crisp), and although I finished up some work and allowed the food to cool down before eating, it was still very good.

Sandwiches nowadays are too trivialized. You stand in some franchise sandwich shop like Subway and you know that nothing out of the ordinary will happen - you forsee that some thinned out ham or roastbeef  soon will be slapped on your generic Italian bread drowned in a dressing from a jar. Blah. Let's dream big kids. 
How about authentic intriguing combination of ingredients making your palate and mind wonder about what else is out there? Outside the globe of America? Goat cheese? Pesto?  Gouda? Amazing breads with names that are hard to pronounce? Why not. This little sandwich shop gives you the opportunity to expand the horizons in a very tasty way. All house choices are very good, trust me. Please don't play God creating your own sandwich. Sandwiches like these are like good  movies - you don't go in a movie theater with a script you prepared at home expecting it to be played to you. You come to be amused.  So you might just as well let this sandwich shop surprise  and entertain you. Cheaper than airfare to Europe and  you won't ask for your money back.

Love this place.  Came with a friend and the service was outstanding. We met the owner, Will....can't believe how great he treated us. I felt like I was in some clandestine bar in a movie. The drinks were awesome!  Cleveland should be proud to have such a authentic establishment.

One day after I satisfy my frozen yogurt craving at Kiwispoon... I get invited out to eat frozen yogurt at Piccadilly.  A rare opportunity to truly compare the two yogurt places.

Here, I tried three flavors - chocolate, pumpkin, and caramel sea salt.  Added toppings of brownie bits, chocolate caramel turtles, and mochi.

Overall, I liked the yogurt better at Kiwispoon. The frozen yogurt seems less rich in Piccadilly's and the flavors are not as strong.  The price per ounce is also marginally higher at Piccadilly's.

There are definitely pluses to Piccadilly's yogurt though.  I liked the toppings better - I thought the mochi tasted better, the brownie pieces were bigger, and the chocolate caramel turtles went great on ice cream.  The chocolate caramel turtles should be a standard topping for both frozen yogurt and ice cream places.  Also, with the huge map of Cleveland Heights behind the cash register, this feels more like an authentic "neighborhood" froyo joint.

When we walked in, we were greeted by the owner and the most humble server I've ever met. The place is well designed, clean and had the right Ethiopian vibe with a modern touch. It's also very spacious. We were given the menus promptly and our server came back shortly to check. He took our order and even offered juice for our toddler... Excellent service.

The food was great. Most importantly, it was authentic. We started with the Sambusa appetizer followed by the Beef Combination and Quanta Firfir. The Sambusas were made to order and came out crispy and hot. The combination was plenty and delicious! The Quanta was one of the best we've ever had.

The owners including the chef came to check on us regularly and offered anything to make the meal more enjoyable. They even asked for feedback.

Definitely coming back again!

Delicious.  We were the first of the dinner crowd on a Saturday night.  We ordered the chicken combo and a lamb dish..  We also scored a couple sambusas.  I'm not a good judge of spice, but to me the meal was quite mild but very flavorful. The service was very good.  She was very pleasant and offered to explain things if we had questions.  No the food did not come out fast, but certainly not slow.  If you want to walk up, order and have mediocre good slopped out in a few minutes I would say try the olive garden.  For delicious authentic food that may take a bit, but will be worth the wait check this place out. I hear they have big things planned for music and a buffet,  I'll definitely be back to check that out.
The absolute best, freshest, yummiest goodness all stuffed into one fantastic perogie.  Do not miss out on this one!  This is as authentic as it gets!  A must have in my freezer at all times!

I stopped by today around 7pm. The time listed on yelp was 5-10pm so I thought maybe they're a dinner only place. Later that night I was informed that their hours are 10am to 6pm!!! The service was fantastic! The people are really nice and accommodating. They served me even though they were closed and their food is fantastic! I had the cheddar and potato pierogies and bacon, cheddar and potatos. I love the bacon on better. They added onions and sour cream! So delicious! I also had the stuffed cabbage. I had two kinds -- one with the saurkraut and the other with tomato sauce. Both were sooo good!! I like the one with saurkraut better. I finished them both. Lastly is the pastry. It is this pastry with homemade whipped cream. I mean, what isn't  homemade here? I see they are hard at work in the back actually making pierogies! This is the real authentic stuff. Definitely a great gem here in Cleveland!
Awesome bbq. Get there early... the brisket sells out quickly. Very reasonable and authentic.

First visit and definitely not my last!!  Amazing BBQ with authentic sides and great portions!!  Today I ordered the two meat with two side,  expecting to get small sample size portions like everywhere e kg se.  Not so here!!!!  

Great size enter portions of Pulled pork and melt in your mouth Brisket.  I ordered the baked beans and mac and cheese with cornbread on the side.  I would have added pics but,  I already done so deep into this meal that their current state would not do justice.  Everything was perfectly flavored (in my opinion),  the two sauces I tried on the side were great! I will be back for sure and I regret that u put off visiting here for so long.  

Easy to get to location, very friendly cashier who answered my questions with a smile and to the guy who I assume was the manager or owner who talked to me before I left and made sure to let me know that they are serving Smoked Corner Beef all day this Saturday for St. Patrick's Day!!!  For the first time In a while I'm happy I am working down the street that day!!!!

First of all, the staff was SO pleasant and helpful which is always refreshing. I was a little wary at first due to its "hole in the wall" appearance, but wow am I glad I gave it a chance! I got the brisket hash- Hands down best brisket I've ever had! I tried the Mac and cheese which was authentic and awesome as well. The sauces were amazing but not even necessary- there's already so much flavor going on. The only thing I'm disappointed about is the fact that I am leaving Cleveland today and will not have a chance to come back for dinner. Within my four day stay I've visited several restaurants and this place is hands down the best (and cheapest) place I've been! 10/10 would recommend ;)

Yes, finally some Asian desserts in Cleveland! The bubble waffles are not bad, not quite as soft and fluffy as the ones in Hong Kong but better than most other places in the States. The real star here that everyone should get are the egg tarts. The crust is buttery and the custard filling is velvety and delicious. I can see these are some of the best egg tarts I've had. If they don't have a batch of tarts ready, you have to wait 30mins for them to make it fresh, but it is completely worth it. The tarts taste extra delicious piping hot! Another noteworthy mention is the Hong Kong milk tea. It's flavor is a lot stronger than other places and is very authentic.

We're a regular here! Not only are the waffles great, but so are their egg tarts (my personal fave), teas, and egg rolls! Someone mentioned that their milk teas have a weird taste to them- thats what authentic HK teas are supposed to taste like :) it may be "weird" at first but you grow to love it! Also, i brought some of their egg tarts to a house warming party and even the older guests who aren't fond of sweets totally finished these egg tarts and asked where i got them from. 
What makes this place so great are the owners: so friendly and caring. They're dedicated to bring the authentic, tasty hong kong pastries, they're constantly experimenting and creating new menus to try. They even spontaneously made us a traditional HK cold remedy drink because we told them we had the flu: hot coca cola with ginger and lemon. The warmth and the deliciousness of their drinks and pastries are the results of the effort, the time, the care they put into them.
If you want to try authentic Hong Kongese type street food, this is the place you go. Highly recommended. This is the best you can have in Cleveland. Their level is comparable to LA and SF.

Last time I was in Cleveland, the only place I could get the Hong Kong style egg waffle was at Mason's Creamery in the Tremont area. Since then, Cleveland has diversified its Asian food options, and Asia Plaza has opened up a place that serves this signature Hong Kong dessert.

I came here with several of my Cleveland friends, as well as my fiance. It has a very nice ambience. There are a variety of ways to customize your egg waffle, as far as what you can put inside the egg waffle and also what you can put on top of it (e.g. ice cream). Additionally, Ball Ball Waffle also has the option of ordering Hong Kong style lemon iced tea as well as Hong Kong style milk tea. I ended up getting a Hong Kong style lemon iced tea and a matcha mochi egg waffle.

The Hong Kong style lemon iced tea tastes exactly like what I would have at Kee Wah or a Hong Kong cafe in the San Gabriel Valley. I did ask for half sugar, which I think helped, as I don't like my drinks too sweet. The matcha mochi egg waffle was made to order, and the addition of matcha on the outside and mochi on the inside made it a super tasty dessert. The condensed milk drizzle also added to the Hong Kongness of the treat.

An amazing addition to Asiatown plaza, and another option to get this classic Hong Kong style dessert that has been heavily modified and diversified in the past few decades. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to try authentic Hong Kong style dessert.

A solid addition to the Asiatown plaza! It's right between Li Wah and Park to Shop, so a great place for dessert after dimsum/grocery shopping. There's also plenty of free parking nearby. 

I thought the flavors were pretty authentic to HK street food. The waffle was airy, light, and not overly sweet. The iced coffee was also one of the closest to what I've tasted in Hong Kong. I liked how everything is made to order so all the food is fresh. However, the restaurant is pretty small so it can easily get crowded and loud. Definitely not good for big parties unless you have another place to eat. Also, I thought the prices were a little on the high side.

We had Hong Style Milk Tea and the Peanut butter waffle. It was really good! The milk tea was high quality, very authentic flavor! We loved what we ordered! I definitely recommend it if you want to treat yourself with some sweet!

I like this place: it's a great little spot inside the plaza that houses Li Wah and Park to Shop. It is surrounded by windows and is an open kitchen, so you get to see everything that goes on. It's fun to watch the waffle gets made, as once the machine is finished cooking it they take a hair dryer to the waffle, which causes the bubbles to rise. 

 I stopped in a few minutes after opening, which is something I try not to do, but the owner greeted me warmly. I ordered the Hong Kong style waffle, which comes with peanut butter and condensed milk drizzled on top, and a milk tea. The waffle takes some time to make, I believe there was a sign that even tells customers to expect a 10 minute wait, but I got to drink my milk tea while I waited. The milk tea is creamy and strong, but not very sweet. To me, it's perfect, but if you like bubble tea or bottled milk tea you might be a little surprised. 


I've never had a bubble waffle before, so I can't really vouch for authenticity, but I really enjoyed it. Imagine a large waffle with a rich taste, enhanced with peanut buttery goodness. I think the peanut butter outweighs the condensed milk, but no complaints here.

All in all, I really enjoyed my first visit here and really want to come back to try more things. It really feels like a street stall with the small (but cozy) space and small menu. The place has a warm vibe to it and you can tell they really care about the food and their customers.

We are from Toronto where there are a ton of these places around but this place makes the best one we've had since Stanley Park in Hong Kong. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, this legit. They've really taken the time to perfect how to make these! The tea is also top notch, well done and truly authentic HK style. This place won't disappoint. Great snack for both sweet, savoury and for tea lovers. Highly recommended!

A perfectly decent place for ramen if you're OK with the offerings having a strong Chinese influence, whether in the flavors or certain ingredients like the char siu. I'm of Cantonese descent myself and found my bowl of ramen to be quite satisfying because it had so many familiar, reassuring Chinese flavors. 

Although this place can be super busy, with a line almost stretching to the door at peak periods, things move along quite quickly. Even though there's only about a dozen tightly-packed seats inside, folks slurp down their bowls and generally don't linger any longer than they have to, so seats do turn over regularly. Service is fast and efficient.

It all might not be the most authentic ramen from a Japanese perspective, particularly if you've traveled and dined extensively in Japan. Some bowls like the #1 char siu bowl are slightly spendy too. I suspect, however, that there aren't many quality Asian establishments in this part of the city or in the greater metropolitan area, so Otani wins by default.

Excellent ramen! After a huge disappointment at a noodle place in Crocker Park a few days ago, my wife, son, and I were still craving a more authentic ramen. We headed to Otami and the Case area for an outing. My sister in-law and her boyfriend also went with us. All were very satisfied. The dishes were complex, well presented, and extremely tasty. The brothes and noodles were awesome. Between the five of us we got three number 1s with pork, a seafood ramen, and a shrimp tempura ramen. My pork ramen was great. My wife's seafood ramen had a lighter and equally tasty broth and my son's shrimp tempura was crispy and flavorful. The place was cozy and dishes were served in a nice big bowl.

You know there isn't that many ramen places to choose from so there isn't much of a competition.  When you first come in, you get s feel of authentic vibes.  They have high tops with stools to sit on.  You can possibly fit 4-6 people comfortably at each table.  

The workers all stand behind their work station, getting ready for anyone and everyone! The prices are averagely priced for a ramen and you get a nice portion for it.  

If you have some trouble deciding on what you would like, check out the pictures they provide on the wall!  They have one screen on there dedicated to showing pictures and a glimpse of the menu.  

The hubby, my friend, and I ordered the spicy ramen.  The spicy ramen wasn't really that spicy in my opinion, but they have chili oil at each table to add to your ramen.  The broth was pretty bland.  The noodles were cooked to perfection.  And the belly pork was so tender and juicy!!! I was very very pleased with the pork and would probably come back to try a different ramen with the belly pork!

Once we ordered, she asked if I was a case student and I said no.  But she asked because case students receive a 10% discount!! But you need to show your ID.  So don't try to fool them!

Overall, I'd bring anyone here with a ramen craving!

I'm not exactly an expert on authentic ramen, but yum!  We've ordered delivery from here a few times, and we've been impressed each time.  It's a little bit expensive, but the portions are generous and the quality is on point.  My husband pretty much always gets the Jigoku spicy ramen, so it must be good.  I'm partial to the torikatsu (chicken) as far as protein goes, but I've tried it with multiple broth options. This is the only place I've ever tried tonkatsu broth and I love it, but the shoyu and miso are pretty delicious too.  When you order ramen to-go or delivery, the broth is packaged separately from the "stuff" which helpfully prevents sogginess upon arrival.  The only appetizer we've tried was the edamame and they were pretty tasty.  It's kind of cool that you can get Ramune Japanese soda as well.

I plan to slowly make my way through the menu, and maybe eventually make myself venture from the noodle bowls to the rice bowls-- but it's hard to branch out when the soup is so good.  I still haven't actually been to the physical location so I can't tell you anything about atmosphere or service, but I can wholeheartedly recommend their ramen.

Broth was a bit lacking in flavor. Quality of ingredients was fine; however choice of ingredients was suspect compared to most authentic ramen shops. The food is really cheap, plus they offer student discounts. Service is quite fast but the shop can get quite packed when they start getting multiple orders.

I knew something was different the moment I saw curry fish balls on the menu at a ramen restaurant. The Cantonese music was another hint, and the Chinese beverages was another hint. When I was able to converse with all the staff in Cantonese, it dawned on me - this ramen restaurant is run exclusively by Chinese people.

Not to say that this fact in itself takes away from the quality of the food. The ramen is still pretty good, and the broth is solid. However, the flavor of the ramen itself does taste distinctly Cantonese. I ordered the miso ramen with char siu, and the ramen had more of a sesame oil flavor than a miso flavor. When I order miso ramen at places in LA and New York, the miso is very very strong, though the miso ramen at Otani tasted more like sesame instant noodles. Additionally, I felt a Cantonese influence in how light the broth was - I expect miso ramen broth to be heavier and thicker.

Some may question authenticity, but then what exactly does one call a Chinese take on a Japanese dish that has its roots in a Chinese dish (liamen)?

The answer: pretty good noodles! I would not rate this as highly as ramen places in major cities, who tend to spend days to prepare their homemade ramen broths, use the highest quality pork, and frequently make their own noodles. However, Otani is good if you're looking for a quick fix, and in many ways reminded me of the type of instant noodles that I can get at Hong Kong diners. Solid, filling, and fairly light.

I plan on coming back and trying their curry fish balls for sure. It's by no means a Japanese staple, but as a Cantonese person myself, I'm always looking for good quality curry fish balls.
It's really difficult to find an authentic Japanese place in Cleveland, but the ramen here is decent! Service is really good too!

if you been to the authentic ramen shops like Totto ramen in NYC, this is the closest to the authentic ramen taste that u can get here in Cleveland. i've been eating ramen from lots of places and finally theres 1 here near downtown cleveland. not disappointed at all.

So, anyone in Cleveland knows how bad our ramen options are (whoever says Noodlecat has obviously never been there). I decided to try Otani that just opened last week. 

Broth was good, a little light and not exactly traditional tonkatsu flavor, but literally the best option around. I asked for an egg which they forgot.  The pork is tough. I'll definitely go back and try the chasu or pork belly. My noodles I think were probably made the day before,. LOTS of clumps. This is a huge turn off for me (and part of the reason why I stopped even trying at Noodlecat). I'm interesting in trying again and seeing what other options they have and how fresh it is on different days. 

As far as ramen in Cleveland, it's an option and maybe the best option. As far as authentic ramen period, you might crave more than this.

The broth for the 1st and 2nd item on the menus is rich and authentic. Noodles were  grear and the meat was well made. Overall very satisfied and the foods were made very quickly too. Good place to grab some good noodles.

Really good ramen, better than competitors in Cleveland across the street. Best and most authentic. If Daikaya in DC is a 10, Otani is a 9. Broth good to the last drop, not chicken soup. Pork belly properly cooked but still soft and chewy, not a cinder. Ramen fresh and succulent and not out of a box. Lots of fresh and authentic toppings including marinated egg, nori, and green onion. Staff friendly and efficient. Will go here again the next time I miss Japan.

Finally! An authentic ramen place finally opens in the area! As the city definitely lacks good ramen joints, I would have to say this is the best ramen I have had in the city. I usually get the #2 pork belly and it is a great portion size and delicious. I love the accompaniments in it - especially the corn which is different than any other place! The portion size is huge, you get a great amount of meat and broth and noodles, that you will surely be full afterwards! Their chicken wings are good too for a side if you can fit them into your belly. 

They also do great take out and package it up nicely so the noodles dont get soggy. Best of all, they are reasonably priced!

As ramen is my favorite food - I am happy to drive over to this area to get some good authentic ramen!
The best place, in my humble opinion, to get Japanese noodle bowls. The food always tastes fresh and the authentic Japanese sodas available are always fun.

I find myself coming here twice a week because I am in love with their Miso Ramen Bowl! I usually just order there and then take my food to-go even though they're on Grubhub. But my food always comes out fast no matter how busy they are. The workers are very kind and bring my to-go order right to me, instead of calling me up to the counter or something less friendly. The meal is the perfect portion size. Love this place so much, highly recommend it if you're craving delicious authentic miso soup!!!

100% the best ramen in the city! Its tiny but absolutely incredible! Its also super fast, i was in and out in under 30 minutes which is great for lunch if you work nearby.

I got the chicken ramen bowl, packed with flavor. I dont have any other references to go off of as far as authentic ramen but this truly did hit the spot with my belly.The owner Joyce is so helpful and sweet. She actually told me that Otani Noodle uses the real alkaline noodle for the true chewy texture of Japanese ramen which is why its so yummy and its truly authentic and one of a kind in cleveland.

Its a tad pricy i mean considering youre paying for ramen and you can get a 10 pack at walmart for $1.00 i guess they have to charge more haha. But otherwise i dont have any negatives to say about Otani.

One of our favorite ramen places. A spinoff of the longstanding (and well-reviewed) Otani Restaurant, they make authentic and high-quality ramen and other dishes. Both of the ramen bases we've tried have been outstanding--the shoyu (soy sauce) type and the tonkotsu soup (pork-based, I think) type. All of the toppings were amazing, as well. Recently tried the spring roll, which was good, too. 
Plus friendly staff, cool decor, good music, and nice location. It has become a must-go place every time we're in Cleveland.

There is no disputing the authenticity and class of this place.  Every single ingredient is made fresh. The price for cocktails is high, as it should be for the quality of the ingredients.  The decor and music is always great, and they have a delightful patio and back room.  It is not as pretentious as it may seem - the bartenders are friendly and accommodating.  The dress code is reasonable and not irrationally enforced.

This would be a five star review except for the fact that I've been coming here for years and I feel as though the quality of the bartenders has declined in the past year or so.  With this menu, the bartenders really need to be spot on in their mixology.  I have no problem telling a bartender my preferences, so in a place like this it should come out perfect every time.  That's a really high standard, so 4 stars is great!

I love people that have unreasonable love and who want to share it with others.

In the case of the Velvet Tango Room, we have people who have unreasonable love for things that are old-fashioned, high-quality, hand-crafted and authentic.

Good:
* Don't worry if you don't know about pisco liquor, or haven't a clue about the "Hemingway daquiri".  Ask about any drink, and any of the lovely bartenders will tell you about them at length.  They'll recommend their favorite, and prescribe what will suit your taste buds.
* My favorite drinks are the aforementioned pisco sours, Hemingway daquiri (unlike any other slushy, sweet daquiri you've ever had), and the Lady in Pink.  The root beer float with bourbon is delicious.
* The bar itself is a sweet little out of the way place, between Tremont and West Side Market, decked out to be wooden and old-fashioned. 
* Live music on the weekends that isn't so loud that you can't be heard.. A nice change from Bier Market (much as I like that place)

Bad:
* Drinks are not cheap here - $15 each the last time I went, so don't come here to liquor up, that's not the point.  But for $15, it's a damn good drink to be sipped slowly and savored.

From the moment we stepped into the VTR I knew it was different. The atmosphere is 1920's speakeasy-esque with music to match. The list of specialty cocktails is thoughtful and novel, featuring plenty of obscure classics that most bartenders would have never heard of. But they take these cocktails to the next level by using premium homemade bitters, mixers, etc. Furthermore, extensive research is put into all the drinks an authentic way. The Ramos Gin Fizz is shaken for a full 5 minutes (although according to the drink's creator, it's actually supposed to be shaken for 15). Martinis are stirred rather than shaken.
  I have two gripes that prevent me from granting 5 stars. First is price. I understand that extra labor and premium ingredients here make the drinks more costly than elsewhere. However, the markup seemed excessive in spite of these measures. A Bombay Sapphire martini cost me $15, or a full 50% more than anywhere else in Cleveland.
  Second is food, or rather, a total lack thereof, even by bar standards. There were about 3 or 4 food options (plus a few desserts). A "speck on rye" appetizer cost us another $15, consisting of nothing more than a few slices of cured bacon on bread. It was bland and generally disappointing.  
 Overall the VTR is worth hitting up. But because of the dearth of food and inflated prices, I probably won't return as frequently as I would otherwise.

The Velvet Tango Room has been on my list of places I needed to go seemingly forever. The reason I never made it here until now was really a matter of logistics and self-control issues regarding alcohol. Driving into the bowels of Tremont EXPLICITLY FOR COCKTAILS is totally inadvisable, especially given my questionable driving skills even when sober. (Just ask my wife...she'll be happy to share her indexed documentation and 26-slide Power Point presentation on 'Why I Shouldn't Be Allowed to Drive'. Or perhaps you're more interested in just the Executive Summary?)  

I couldn't hold out any longer, though. The desire for real jazz and fancy homemade cocktails overrode my concerns about a long and recklessly foolish drive back to Richfield. (I am writing this review, so you can draw reasonable inferences that I made it home alive.) 

But I digress.....

In a city riddled with industrial urban decay, the VTR has managed to situate itself on the most desolate, dimmest street possible. It's basically on a forgotten side-street amongst a gloomy row of post-residential houses, directly-facing and almost-underneath a huge fucking steel bridge. (It's a good place to look for "motivational-speaker" Matt Foley's van.) A tiny purple neon sign reading "Velvet Tango Room" in the window is the only sign that you're in the right place....hell, it's the only sign of life anywhere! The location couldn't be any more obscure. I'm guessing that Paulius' rent be cheap.

Upon entering the front door, the world beyond it dissolves, and you stroll into a clean and classy scene, with jazz playing in the background. We arrived before the crowds, so were able to find choice seats at the bar and receive the full attention of the amazing staff, patiently helping us navigate through Volumes I and II of their leather-bound cocktail menu. These people take their craft very seriously. They tended over our drink selection with such gravity and consultation....like a team of doctors presiding over Al Roker's gastric-bypass. ("Oh, look, it's Ann Curry's right arm!") The staff were going to make sure we got exactly the right cocktail. I instantly wanted to be best friends with everyone behind the bar. My liver and I have rarely felt so spoiled and special.

And yes, the cocktails were indeed delicious. I was honestly expecting more Hemingway-macho-poisonous-whisky-hair-on-your-chest-scary-things, but most of the drinks were instead vibrant, light, and fresh. The Moscow mule was a standout, full of intense ginger. The cocktails were full of tastes exciting and unfamiliar.

The VTR also gets extra points for supplying some authentic jazz music and musicians...something that I find inexplicably rare in this city. Some of the music that I have heard passed off as "live jazz" around town haunts me. Taking liberties with 'Sweet Caroline' on a drum-machine is NOT jazz. Playing Jimmy Buffet in diminished seventh chords is NOT jazz, either. You know who you are.

My only complaint...and it's minor... is that the dÁE©cor is a bit too "ew construction". In some ways, it strikes me as a very-nicely decorated finished basement at your lawyer friend's suburban McMansion. At the same time, however, I appreciate the honesty of it....no one is pretending that this place is a hold-over from the Prohibition Era or anything...but I guess I've been spoiled by places like The Green Mill in Chicago, which reportedly boasts actual gangster-era bullet holes in the walls put there by Al Capone's thugs (or perhaps Geraldo Rivera's publicist). Anyway, the transcendent, vintage cocktails and classic black-and-white movies being shown above the bar at the VTR made up for any moodiness elsewhere lacked.

If the VTR ever was a secret, the secret is definitely out now, and it's seemingly become a local curiosity for everyone who's ever read a newspaper and sought an urban adventure. As the evening progressed, I was looking outside to see how many of these people arrived via tour bus. Let's just say I'm not sure everyone there was seeking the purity of experience I was. At it's inception, I'm guessing VTR would have been an easy 5-stars. Success and notoriety have diluted that to 4 or 4-1/2. Still a unique and cool place, though. It's gonna take a lot more doucebags than this to ruin the Velvet Tango Room.o

Bring the credit card because these cocktails are expensive folks but you truly get what you pay for!  This is an EXPERIENCE, not just a drink.  The neighborhood is dicey, the exterior understated, the decor is classic, the bar is authentic, the bartenders are hot, and the drinks are 'bar none', the BEST!  Try the Moscow Mule!

I love this place for lunch in the Playhouse Square district. They are super accommodating of my nut allergy - even changing their gloves without needing to be asked! The house salad is super delicious and fresh. Servings are extremely generous, and the home-cooked meats are juicy. I return at least once a week at lunch and the staff is always cheerful and friendly. Highly recommended!

An indispensable part of the iconic West Side Market and a Cleveland corner stone in finding European Import groceries. I've been shopping here since I first immigrated to the area from Germany (more than 35 years ago). For years this store was the only place around Cleveland to offer things like Nutella, Marzipan, those delicious individually wrapped soft caramel candies from Poland or hundreds of other food items people on the other side of the Atlantic take for granted. Sure, you can find Nutella at big US grocery chains now, but Mediterranean Import Foods still has the best value, and their groceries are always fresh and delicious! Whether you need ingredients for a special meal or just want to indulge in some of the finer things like fresh dates or exotic spices, it's all here! Operated the old fashined way like a European "Ma and Pa's" shop (Germans would call it "Tante Emma Laden"), this places gives you an authentic taste of times gone by. Whatever you bring home from this store, you probably won't find better food or a better value anyplace else. 5 stars from this reviewer.

I ate at Cilantro last night, which was their opening day. Very good!  It is in the old Chipotle, and the decor is essentially the same, as is the set up. Basically cafeteria style and you tell them what toppings you want. But everything tasted great and authentic and fresh, and the staff was very nice, though obviously still learning. I believe they are all Hispanic, which bodes well. :) Standouts for those of us who went: shrimp tacos,  carnitas, and the guacamole. All delish!
There were a few items they didn't have yet, including alcohol (next week they will have beer and margaritas), "choco-flan" (should have by today), and perch for tacos (soon). Tacos are $2.50 ea, large burritos or bowls are around eight or nine bucks, $1 extra to add guacamole. Note to haters of the herb, cilantro: most items don't have cilantro in them, you can have it added.

This place is amazing. We started going every week. It's authentic Mexican but has the same set up as a chipotle or Moe's. I don't mind paying a few extra bucks to enjoy this. They have great portions of the protein you pick and the queso comes on it at no extra cost. The service is really wonderful, the people there are really nice. I can tell this place is becoming extremely popular.
Nice small spot. Like an authentic Chipotle. Homemade salsa, friendly staff, open late 3 days out the week, good music selection and TACO TUESDAYS!
Good food but ultimately a bit over priced in my opinion. Think Chipotle but more authentic. Coincidentally I believe this used to be a Chipotle location. Lots of fun toppings to choose from!

I've been here a couple times now but make a point to eat here when I come to Cleveland. It's super delicious, authentic, and cheap. 

I love this spot. The portion sizes are huge and they load up your order. The meats are cooked really well and there's a couple more options than you'd find at a chipotle. Beef tongue and al pastor are delicious but my favorite here is the carnitas. 

The staff here is nice and friendly. The guys who load up your order are very generous and the people who check you out are funny high white guys.

It's great to have a locally-owned, authentic mexican restaurant replace the Chipotle in Coventry Village. I just had a chicken taco and shrimp taco and they were amazing... and only cost $5.

If you liked Chipotle -- you'll LOVE Cilantro Taqueria!

Amazing!! Since moving to Cleveland from the west coast I haven't found an authentic taco, but this place is great. Simple tacos on two corn tortillas with a bunch of meat options and toppings like a true taco bar. Food is a reasonable price too. I'll be a regular here.

I and my boyfriend stopped for a late dinner, and at first glance looks a lot like a chipotle type establishment but the food is waaaay better. Between the two of us we had surf and turf, chorizo, lengua, and pastor tacos, and al were excellent. Tasted very authentic.

I don't even know where to begin, this place is authentic and well cooked Mexican food. It's fast casual (set up like a chipotle), with a variety of alcoholic drink options. They have unique options like lengua (which is my favorite), but also amazingly cooked carnitas and steak. I usually get a bowl, which comes with a choice of Mexican or white rice, and is enough food for two definitely. They have DEADLY margaritas, which usually come with a floater and a shot in the glass ($12 pitchers on fri/sat). The staff is great, the owner is usually there and also working with a smile on his face. I came here originally to find a michelada and found the best Mexican food in this area. You will not be disappointed. Forgot to mention, they make the best salsa verde and I usually don't tell them to add it to my meal because they have it in the condiment station and I like to pile it on myself.

This place is a hidden gem of Coventry!! The people inside are super cool and friendly! The Al Pastor is delicious and they have some of the best chorizo I've had in my life. The elotes are pretty tasty especially with a few slices of lime on the side!!! I had lost all hope in finding an authentic Mexican place when I moved to Cleveland but this has by far won my heart. Prices are very fair for portion sizes and they have plenty of drink options too. Seating area is very clean and comfy!!! The salsa bar is definitely one of the best parts too!! This was a great addition to Coventry and I hope it stays around!!!!!

I had the al pastor, lengua, shrimp, chicken, and chorizo tacos. All were really good except for the chicken which was a bit bland. It was pretty authentic - grilled jalapeÁE±os at the salsa bar and corn tortillas. Friendly service. Can't wait to go again.
Cancel Chipotle, cancel Moe's, cancel Qdoba. Most authentic option around. Bowls are massive and full of flavor.
They have succulent grilled shrimp! That's all I need for a great bowl or burrito. They have authentic meats with grease which enhance the flavors.

I'm so glad this place took over the old Chipotle! They have the same format as Chipotle but their food quality is authentic, delicious, and fresh! They have margaritas too! The shrimp borrito bowl is my favorite! They also have fresh extra sauces and limes you can help yourself to. As I'm writing this I want to go there right now!!
Wow! Great authentic tacos! Way better than chipotle. Reasonably priced, fast service, and a great adult beverages ! Worth the visit

It's very Chipotle-esque in set up and concept but with much more authentic food. I haven't tried all of the things yet, but I love the tacos al pastor and the bowls are great. I like that the fast casual set up and hope it works out. Nice to have the option in the area still!

I had a burrito and tacos from here when it first opened... so i came here 2 times when it was new. It was ok. Very authentic but i felt it was a little bland

Now months after they've been open, I feel like the rice and meat got way better and I love it!.... 

always come back and try things again!!!

Definitely one of my favorites in town. I drive over 30 min just to eat here almost weekly. Hoping for an expansion to the west side of Cleveland! Love the build your own concept while keeping the ingredients authentic.

I visited on a Friday night (2 August 2019) around 10:30pm which is late but I had to eat something. I was in the neighbourhood and I needed to eat. I had just come from the MIX party event at the Cleveland Museum of Art so all that dancing left me famished plus I hadn't had dinner yet...LOL. Luckily, they close at 2am on Fridays.

SERVICE -- I walked up to the counter and ordered. The 2 employees greeted me and one of them took my order. Very nice and general service.

TACOS -- The taco's here are very delicious. My friend ordered shrimp tacos and she loved them especially since you can add a ton of toppings such as tomatoes, salsa, etc. They are $3 to $3.50 a piece depending on what meat you get. They also have a vegetarian taco which is filled with vegetables. 

Similar to the tacos at La Plaza Supermarket (read my review of that place), these tacos here are also super SMALL. I was told that the tacos and food in general here are authentic because the owner is from Mexico so that's cool.

I ordered 1 Shrimp taco ($3.50) and 1 Surf & Turf taco ($3.50) which is a mixture of Steak and Shrimp. Both tasted delicious with the mild salsa that I added. The shrimp taco came on a flour tortilla. I preferred the taste of the flour tortilla. The steak & shrimp taco came on 2 corn tortilla's. The corn tortilla has a unique taste so next time, I'll get all tacos on a flour tortilla. 

I was still hungry after eating but the 2 small tacos that I ate still satisfied my appetite plus it was late so I didn't want to eat too much. Both tacos cost $3.50 but I checked my bank and I was only charged $6.50 total so perhaps the shrimp taco itself was just $3. Maybe somehow I got .50 cents discount....haha. Nonetheless, the taco price is reasonable and quite typical of most other restaurants.

LOCATION -- They are located in the Cleveland Heights neighbourhood in an area with local shops. Parking can be a pain but there is a small parking lot on Coventry Road with meters. I didn't have to use the parking meters when I parked so perhaps they are free after a certain time.

Overall, I recommend their tacos. Come here if you are seeking a late night food spot that is better than fast food. They also have rice bowls on their menu just like Chipotle but the rice bowls here are $2 more than the Chipotle ones.

****
- 112 total reviews in 2019
- 321 total overall Yelp reviews
- Reviewed on 3 August 2019

I really like cilantro tacqueria for some fast, great tasting food & drinks. They're conveniently located on a street that has other food places as well, if you're in the mood to eat! 

Cilantro tacqueria, in my opinion, is a better/more authentic version of chipotle/moe's/qdoba. Their food always tastes fresh and full of flavor. They give you a TON more in quantity than the other chains. I can never finish a whole burrito bowl in one sitting. They also have happy hour deals every day of the week, which includes drink AND food deals depending on the day. Their margaritas have never failed yet. Everyone I know who has tried one has had nothing but great things to say. They offer a variety of flavors as well. 

It's totally affordable and awesome service, I definitely recommend trying it out!

We had a large group and ordered most of the dishes. The beef noodle soup is the best I've had in Cleveland! It's very difficult to find a place that has both the perfectly cooked beef and the authentic noodles. I would definitely come back a lot for this noodle soup. The pork belly in baked bun and cumin lamb in baked bun are also very authentic! I can totally have them every day. We shared the Szechuan chili pots. They are very flavored. I especially like that they put various kinds of vegetables. I am really excited that this restaurant is bringing so many authentic food to the university Circle!

The food is NOT authentic Chinese food, beef noodle soup is way too sweet and noodle is very soggy. cumin lamb in baked bun, the lamb is hard and over cooked, but didn't marinate well so it still has the stinky taste of lamb. 
I went there because of the Hong Kong style bubble tea with milk crown, it does taste pretty good, but the boba in there was not made very well, basically melted in the drink, and had no taste. Hope they can improve the tapioca in there.

I visited here on opening day! August 10, 2018! Glamorous! My understanding of this restaurant is that it was opened by a Case Western graduate who wanted to provide some more authentic Chinese food to the neighborhood.

On entering, they've kept a lot of the old architecture that was at ninja city, which I think was a wise choice. It looks great.

Because it was the first night there were open, there were a few hiccups. I don't eat meat, but I do eat fish, and I asked if anything could be made vegetarian - 95% of the dishes have a meat ingredient listed - and I was told that one dish could be vegetarian. Unfortunately, when the dish came out, it had sausage in it, and I was informed that it could not be made vegetarian because it was all made in one pot. No problem! I ordered a tofu dish. I was subsequently informed that the sauce for that dish has meat, so they kindly brought out all of the different components of the dish for me to eat, which I thought was a lovely gesture.

Unfortunately, I think the dish didn't come together very well as separate components and ended up being reasonably bland. My friends, however, loved their bao and pork buns. 

Ultimately, I think Nujoy is good right now but not great. It shows a ton of promise, but organization right now is of paramount importance.

A couple of suggestions:

1. Label on the menu which dishes can be made vegetarian

2. Generally, write what ingredients are in the dishes on the menu so that people with food allergies can choose accordingly.

3. Keep making great food. I suppose that isn't a suggestion.

I plan to visit again in a month or so when they've ironed out the kinks. Looking forward to it!

This place is definitely better than all the other restaurants in the area when it comes to true authentic Chinese food. Being a student from China, I cannot find a better place to grab lunch and dinner. I love their noodle in soybean paste, true Beijing style! Also the kababs are awesome too. Some of my friends say it's a bit overpriced, but I keep telling them you can't compare a sit down restaurant with good interior vs. a takeout only place, so in my opinion the prices are justified. 

I also enjoy their tea drinks, unlike anything you can find in Cleveland!

I do not recommend this restaurant.  Most of the items were Americanized, you might as well go to a Chinese take out restaurant.  The grilled squid didn't taste grilled, baked bun is way way way overpriced.  Spring roll was supposed to use the rice skin, but they use the Americanized tortilla with thick skin...the only good things were the beef noodle soup and boiled dumplings... my chili beef was very dry and chewy, vegetables in the chill beef was Americanized...  

There is not much authenticity about the food here.  I do not recommend.

NÁE¼joy is an impressive little restaurant in University Circle.  Parking is certainly a hassle but we were able to find street parking a block away.  

There is a small bar/lounge area on the first level.  Most of the dining tables are on the second level.  We were greeted and seated by the lady bartender.  There was also another server on duty.  We came for lunch which uses the same menu for dinner.  Other diners included Chinese students from Case,  a few casual dinners and maybe some contractor types at the bar.  

Given the Chinese students dining there,  you know The cuisine is authentic Szechuan with some buns and thrown in.  We had two noodle dishes, one noodle soup and two vegetable dishes.  The food was very good,  except the beef noodle soup was a little bland.  The green tea with cheese foam was interesting, but I don't think I would order it  again.
Really authentic Chinese food. The steamed dumplings and the bao are some of my go-to favorites. And get the warm soy milk if you are so inclined.

Went here for dinner yesterday and previously thought this place was average at most but would not go back again. Nothing authentic about any of the food here and we end it up ordering the pork rib chili pot and cumin lamb as well the bao. Bao clearly frozen which is fine but chili pot rib came out luke warm and cumin lamb was cold. Not sure how that's possible if cumin lamb was ordered 15 min before it came out unless it was left over or refrigerated from prior. In any case, food was too salty and ate the pork rib chili pot and definitely got food poisoning. Was nauseated afterwards and had to retch/vomit in the toilet bowel as if I was in college. Pretty sure there meat has been left out or expired. This was of course followed by diarrhea all night. I would avoid this place at all cost unless you want a bowel cleanse
Nice bubble tea. Good place to find some authentic Chinese  dishes.

Any place that rivals me in the amount of authentic Care Bear items they own deserves to get 5 stars. The new space is so much bigger. I love the way the store is divided up. It's a great place to just go in and walk around if you're feeling nostalgic.

Holy cow what a interesting toy store. Penny candy for a buck, Dollar toys for ten.  A cool place overstocked with retro and authentic vintage toys. Strange action figures ( like Jesus and Moses with props), and 1000's of tiny little things that you can keep in a cigar box or your pocket of your dungarees  till mom washes them... Boo Radley merchandise! Plus Kiss, Brady bunch and some adult birthday crap as well... Old library card catalog cabinets full of plastic and glass things, marbles, and other small things you should not put in your nose.

I asked the heavily tatted, bearded, bored, vacant, inattentive, texting dude ( standing next to his fellow female coworker - same attitude, different shirt)  at the counter if  he could tell me what the very cool Monkey Mobile Matchbox car in the case cost. He asked if I intended to buy it. I replied that I didn't know till I found out what it cost. He harrumphed, and, muttering under his beard, began the long and obviously painful process of unlocking the cabinet and reaching in to check the price.
I felt so bad for him...in fact, I told him to nevermind...I didn't NEED the item anyway.

Right after I wrote this, A very nice and well respected member of the Cleveland Yelp Community wrote to me. I think this exchange is telling:

Mr X:

Hey Mike, Big Fun is truly an AWSOME place but the hipster doofuses that are employed there need to be overlooked...
They're nothing more than cash register button pushers that don't have a clue about MOST of the stuff in Big Fun...
There is another one on the west side that should be better and consider that next time you are in town.
Cheers!
 

Mike M.

10 minutes ago
Thanks for the heads-up.

Problem is - the staff IS the business to anyone who is not just walking through. I wanted to buy a few rather pricey things, but damn is I'll give my money to anyone who acts extremely annoyed that I was there.

Nope ... never again!

Peace :)
 

Mike M.4 minutes ago

Mr X,

Sorry to beat a dead horse, but there are three prime aspects to a business.

Environment, product and service.

I can't overlook a dirty, mean  a$%*$le his wages. Why does the management think so little of their clientele that they not only charge 2-3 times wholesale but also subject them to people like this whilst trying to buy ??

Just a bunch of sheep I guess..

Just my thoughts, thanks for the words!

Mr X:

Yup...
I get it...
Peace!
 
Mr X:

A moment ago
Hey no worries, I share your mindset about that...I've done my fair share of retail therefore expect  certain things...
Big Fun dropped the ball here....
Almost makes me want to call and chat with the owner...
Cheers!


So there it is - very very cool, very very unfriendly place.

Come to think of it... I don't need anything there.

Out.

The curse of this space has been lifted -- Spice, you've really done it! 

That was hands down THE BEST (yes, that required all caps) meal out I've had in a long time. 

So, we all know the concept of this place, yes? I don't need to go into heavy detail describing the decor or talking about how much of everything is locally-sourced, farm-to-table, etc., etc. We've all read enough of these to know--although it's still very impressive. 

But honestly, living in Ohio City, where there are plenty of fabulous places, also sourcing locally within a few feet and a just a few miles, I was wondering if this place was really going to be able to surprise me... Well, it did more than that. It impressed my face off. LIterally, picture my face melting off from pure impressed feelings. 

...Sorry

We stopped in late on a Friday night starving and as soon as we walked in, we were acknowledged. Now, this may seem strange to others, but I loved that the first person to say "hello" to us was the bartender who was cleaning some glassware. See, the bar is located right next to the front door. Instead of walking in and seeing a hostess at a stand staring at you, it felt much more relaxed, yet personal. Hard to explain, but I like that. 

In fact, the service the entire time was impeccable. From the bartender who greeted us, the host/water guy who took us right to a table (and read the specials/made some suggestions) to our waiter who was the definition of a perfect server. Professional, yet talkative. I don't know how anyone has ever had a less than stellar service experience here, because they were on it. 

The food was incredible. We started with the mushroom beignets and although I've had authentic beignets in New Orleans, I really didn't know what to expect. Welp, they knocked this out of the park. No wonder why it's a mainstay on the menu--if you don't order theses, you'll be sorry. They're not *super* mushroom-y, but very savory and the honey goat cheese creme fraiche in combo with these crispy dumplings is life changing. 

We also gave the tomato bisque special a try, since the host recommended it. I know what you're thinking--boring. Bisque is so done. This was divine, like fill a hottub with it and marinate in it good. The bowl was clean. 

For main courses, I orded the pan-seared walleye (and keep in mind they change their menu very often) which was served with broccolini, carrot puree and tomato ginger verde. All I can tell you is to get there ASAP to make sure you try this dish before they change the menu again. The fish was light, perfected seared and there were two filets! The verde was perfect... well, everything just went together perfectly. My boyfriend ordered the lamb two ways. It came with a couple of shanks and some meatballs. I tried it and it stopped my world. I must have more lamb in my life. 

Normally we're not dessert people, but we were convinced the special was to die for--and of course, it was. I honestly cannot remember was it was, totally, but I know it had waffles with a frozen creme concoction. Happy, happy times. 

I will also note that I allowed the server to suggest me a white wine to go with my walleye and what he suggested is now my favorite white wine of all time. 

Perfect everything. Thoroughly impressed. Our new favorite restaurant (myself and the pickiest man alive, my boyfriend.)

Came here recently on a date with my husband! We enjoyed our time here at Spice and thought everything was pretty solid. Spice has a wonderful vision and mission to use as much local goods as possible. Turns out Ohio is a great place to do this with all our amazing local farms!

Our favorite appetizer was a special: fresh halibut chowder with lobster oil. MM. It was good! Please make this a regular menu item! The flavor was really great. 5 for the chowder.

We also had a 3 local-mushroom pesto flatbread with goat cheese. The mushrooms were oyster, chantrelle, and one more I can't remember...the mushrooms were fresh and good tasting. 4 for the flatbread.

I ordered the Spice Acres Polenta with ratatouille and eggplant puree, which I think was a vegan dish. The polenta was fried rather than creamy, a good complement to the puree and ratatouille. The eggplant had a pretty strong flavor, but it was intriguing enough to keep eating.

My husband ordered the special - fresh trout (that day!) with sweet potato puree. This was amazing!!! They gave him the entire fish -- something you don't see very often except in authentic Chinese restaurants (mmm). I loved that they did this because I feel that we were able to enjoy every aspect of the fish, from the regular filet to the cheeks, etc. It was also served like someone had just caught it, fried it up, and served it. So great. 

Overall, we enjoyed our time. One thing I noted..they don't give complimentary bread, so be sure to order some appetizers if you are coming in hungry. Other than that, be enjoy the local and fresh dishes!

Outstanding, authentic Italian food. Atmosphere was nice, low lighting but not too dim. Waiter was very knowledgeable with the menu and wines. I have a wheat intolerance and the chef was able to make adjustments to my meal and it was still lovely. A good app to try was the calamari, it was mouth watering. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars was that the waiter left us waiting at several points during the meal for him to return to refill drinks and bring us the bill. Would recommend for a fancy date, company dinner, special occasions.

Truly average Food.  I wont even call it real Italian cuisine.  I just came from Quartino's in Chicago which puts Michaelangelos to shame.  Superb authentic Italian meal at 1/2 the cost that this place charges.  They try and mask it with a fancy atmosphere, but the food quality just isn't there.  The Pappardelle Bolognese was sadly bland, no fresh flavor, and had a Chef Boyardee taste to it. I thought I could salvage the meal with the  "home made Gelato".  This was a joke when it comes to gelato.  It was flavorless frozen cream with a texture of ice crystals.  Chef needs to take a trip to Chicago and dine in some real Italian restaurants there.

Good eats+ good service + better company = perfection

This review is long overdue, as the Mister and I treated ourselves to a nice dinner for Valentine's Day this past year. Better late than never, right?

We decided to try a spot that has been on my list for AGES. Michaelangelo's, a fine establishment just across the street from us, has received rave reviews since it opened its doors in 2006. In fact, last year the restaurant was Zagat Rated!

Review highlights:

This romantic retreat offers authentic Northern Italian Cuisine from chef/co-owner Michael Annandoro, along with an extensive selection of wines and a stylish bar area. With a large fireplace for winter and a patio for warmer weather, its an ideal choice for a special night out.

We started with the house multi-grain bread and flavored olive oil.

We ordered our "go-to" Italian appetizer, which is normally any dish that includes mozzarella and prosciutto. As soon as we spotted the "Bufala," we knew we had to have it. Described on the menu as buffalo mozzarella, prosciutto di parma and roasted red peppers, this dish was the perfect way to kick off our dinner. The mozzarella was rich, creamy and a great match for the salty prosciutto.

Knowing that I'd be ordering an indulgent treat, I thought it would be best to order something light. But light and healthy doesn't mean flavorless - NO SIREE. This simple arugula salad was packed with incredible flavors! I loved the rich quality of the olive oil and the lemon was such a refreshing touch. The salad contained minced garlic and onion, as well as salty, savory Parmesan cheese. The Mister stole a few bites and proclaimed it to be one of the best salads he's ever tasted (Joey's Ceasar Salad in Chagrin Falls in also on the list).

For my "dinner" I ordered the Minestrone soup. Without a doubt, this was one of the heartiest Minestrones I've ever had. This thing was chock-full of root vegetables and beans -- so filling! It had quite a kick, too (luckily my whimpy taste buds could handle it, though!).

The Mister was kind enough to let me pick from all the decadent dessert offerings. In addition to the standard menu, the server explained some of the Valentine's Day features. I heard the words "chocolate bomb" and was sold. The chocolate coating contained rich and creamy chocolate mousse - like a little present from the chocolate Gods! While some chocolate dishes can be too rich and quickly weigh you down, this was the perfect balance. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

The Mister and I decided that we'll be heading back to Michaelangelo's very soon. But this time we BOTH plan on ordering soup and salad  - that way we'll have room for an extra dessert!

This was such a great evening! The ambiance of the restaurant was very romantic and I loved every minute of chatting with the Mister and enjoying his company. Let's face it, Valentine's Day dinners have a pretty bad rep. From noisy and over-crowded restaurants, to poor service and cold food, I've heard all the horror stories. But if anything, Michaelangelo's went above and beyond to make sure our dining experience was special. Our waiter was so helpful and attentive and we never felt rushed. Make sure you give Michaelangelo's a try for your next special occasion -- they'll make sure you leave with some great memories

Having been to many of Cleveland's Italian restaurants, my fiance and I generally enjoyed our time at Michaelangelo's, but likely won't be back. It's one of the pricier (if not priciest) establishments around Little Italy, and while the dark decor in the bar area and happy hour features were impressive, the rest of the restaurant lacked the character and authenticity you get at other Little Italy restaurants. Authenticity also seemed to lack in the food - my fiance ordered the Ossobuco, which was *drowning* in marinara sauce. The risotto tasted as though it had been rushed - not creamy as it should have been. The halibut I had completely lacked flavor, and I had to salt every bit of the meal I was presented with. Our recommendation is to try this place for happy hour, but avoid for the main course.

If you are looking for authentic Italian food in Cleveland this is definitely a place to check out. Occupying the mid to high end of the price scale Michaelangelo's boasts amazing service and terrific food. I enjoyed the lobster ravioli in particular

The best I can really say for this is that it did not make me sick. I love Chinese food, be it authentic Chinese food or greasy Americanized "Chinese" food but this meal failed to be an adequate representation of either. The chicken and broccoli just had an off flavor and the potstickers were rather hard and tasteless. I did like the dipping sauce that came with the potstickers. I had takeout so it is possible that this accounted for my disappointment. Unfortunately, I am not willing to risk another bad meal.
Service was polite and the dining room appears very pleasant. If the food quality isn't there, though, everything else is kind of irrelevant.

There are a few times life that a meal is expertly planned....... I have dined here on a number of occasions. I did not find oily vegetables nor centipedes in my food. I walked in to a very nicely lit nicely set restaurant that had great service, a full bar, hot, fresh food served on beautiful China, soft music, great restaurant that was clean and rather reasonably priced. I don't need to come from China to tell you this. I suspect the food is not that authentic so don't fret- its a great place and a great place to take a date.

The decor and vibe were very relaxed and authentic. The food too was quite good. I've been in Cleveland for over 6 months now and I think this is the best Chinese place I've tried here. We ordered the chicken Lo Mein and sweet and sour chicken, both of which were tasty. The tea also got a thumbs up.

A star off because the menu was a bit confusing and the waiter had to go around explaining it to everyone. (Which could be good because they made sure you didn't end up with something you didn't want.)

Yup, not very authentic, just so-so food.  Not very impressed.  Some of my friends really like this place, but they are also the friends that rave about PF Changs.  So... I guess if you like Americanized Chinese food and don't dare venture out to the Asia Plaza area, it's the place for you.

I was looking to celebrate Chinese New Year but was disappointed that it was similar to Chinese take out food on a nicer platter. It is heavy in sauce, although the setting appears to be very Cantonese. I had a chicken and vegetable dish, and would be willing to return to try other items, but having higher expectations for Chinese food, I would definitely make the venture to Asiatown for closer to authentic crafted cuisine.

Honestly, the food was so good I dove right in and did not take any pictures. I am from Pittsburgh, I've also been to Thailand, and I cant find an amazing Thai place in Cleveland, but I finally did with Banana Blossom. I love spice and when i say they dont lie, THEY DO NOT LIE. I got a three out of five and it was so so hot(drunken noodles). I got the scallion pancakes to start, a thai iced tea and the pad se ew (drunken noodles). My friend got the pad thai with the default of chicken and shrimp it was so good. And I could tell some people working there were speaking thai, so authentic and my new fave place. I also love the decor, the colors on the wall give it such a warm vibe, I'm obnoxiously obsessed.

So many options here!  I love Thai food and if you are looking for authenticity this is the Thai restaurant to try.  So good and so much to choose from.  I love the basil fried rice, but you definitely need to tell the cooks what spice level you want or you will need a lot of water.  For me, the spicier the better!  Must try guys!

The food here is awesome!! I am Thai so I can really tell that many dishes served here are very authentic. I love Pad See Iw here very much. The Thai Basil, Garlic Chicken, and Crispy Duck basil are also amazing. The staffs and the restaurant owner are very very friendly. This is so far my most favorite Thai restaurant in Cleveland.

This is my favorite place for Thai food in Cleveland. It's an authentic Thai restaurant tucked away in a cozy side street, away from the hustle and bustle of Ohio City's main street of restaurants and breweries. I have tried almost everything on their menu, and I highly recommend the Pad Thai dish if you fancy the classic noodles, the Pad See Ew dish if you crave thicker and wider noodles with a more soy saucy taste, and also the Curry dishes if you want to add some spice into your life. Service is friendly and accommodating. If you haven't been here before, they tend to recommend you start off your spicy level at 1 out of 5. I think 3/5 is the maximum I'm able to handle. As a tip, ask for extra spice on the side. They take reservations over the phone, which is helpful for busy dinner times if you have a large party and don't want to wait. They also do carry out and close at relatively late hours which is awesome! Free street parking is located along the side road of the restaurant, which is convenient. Overall, Banana Blossom is a great place for a dinner date, a family meal outing, or a satisfying foodie experience with a group of friends in an intimate setting. Highly recommend!

There's a tough competition in Cleveland for Thai food, but Banana Blossom has won the best Thai food award in my opinion :) 

I ordered the pad see ew and spicy crispy duck. Both were so amazing!! The pad see ew has a very authentic taste with super thick, chewy and delicious noodles :) Their spice levels are a little different from other places. I asked for my usual medium spice level, which was actually a little too spicy for me! So their mild is probably equivalent to medium in other places. And the CRISPY DUCK. Oh dear god, this is life changing!! The dish comes with several pieces of fried duck drenched with some savory red curry sauce. MmMm it's soosososoooo good! You just have to try it for yourself! 

If you are a big fan of Thai food, then you need to check this place out!

A hidden gem in Ohio City. The noodles and veggies are fresh and delicious. Homemade pot stickers and sauce are savory and tender.  The piece d'resistance, however, is the Coconut Soup. It tastes and smells amazing, so much that I have been thinking of it since dinner yesterday! Do yourself a favor and frequent this family-owned authentic Thai restaurant.

This week I had the best and most authentic Thai food that I have ever eaten! 
The chef even came out to assist my companion and I in determining the items that we might want to consider ordering.
He then came out again to see is we were enjoying our selection.
Quiet and relaxing atmosphere in which to enjoy a meal.

A great selection of delicious meals at affordable prices.  Cozy atmosphere with lovely authentic Thai decor.  We have enjoyed the pleasant and polite service and the excellent dishes during multiple visits.  I look forward to going back there.

Even though this restaurant is in such a random part of town and it's quaint and not all that bustling, Banana Blossom was delicious.
I started my meal with a Thai Iced Tea. Perfect. Not too sweet and overdone with the milk, and not too bitter.
I ordered the Lard Na with wide rice noodles at a Level 3 (Thai Spicy). I love spicy food, but level 3 was surprisingly more hot than I expected. It was still delicious, and I was able to devour my bowl, but I'd be lying if I said I didn't feel a bit warm with my mouth burning. Nevertheless, mama didn't raise no b*tch, so I killed it. The spice was nice, but I think next time I'll go with Level 2, so it's even more enjoyable without worry or sweat.
Based on the taste of this Lard Na, it's approved by me. I order Lard Na at every Thai restaurant I visit, and this place did not let me down. Tastes pretty dang authentic. Yum!

Fresh and delicious food, elegantly served in reasonable portions, attentive service, serene surroundings.  The pad thai was tasty and subtle, while the spicy crispy duck was nicely browned outside, meltingly tender inside, and accompanied by a sauce so delicious that my dinner companion kept stealing spoonfuls off my plate.  The salad and drinks were also inviting.  We will definitely be visiting again (and again and again.)  By the way, another diner ordered a dish marked "spicy" and then complained that it was "hot."  It was returned to the kitchen with no arguments and gracious apologies and replaced with something blander.  I ordered hot and would not have minded more authentic heat!  However, the goodness of the ingredients makes this restaurant a palate pleaser.  Banana Blossom is the genuine article and an outstanding restaurant.
Best Thai food in Cleveland. Better than Peppermint in Pepper Pike or any other place in town. Without a doubt the best and only authentic option.

Fantastic Thai food that is full of flavor and desired level of spice!  The menu has lots of variety with the Pad See Iw being my favorite as the sauce is great and the noodles are cooked to perfection.  The space itself feels authentic and relaxing, while it is also in a good part of Ohio City for quick pickup/takeout.

An already known "A lister" Thai restaurant in Cleveland! This place is off the beaten path on the outskirts of Ohio City but it is amazing! Spice lovers- this cook knows how to bring the heat. The restaurant is small and very nicely decorated with authentic Thai decor and art pieces. The flavor, presentation and vibrancy of color and veggies is so enjoyable. The staff is so kind and thoughtful. I was given a free appetizer with my to go meals as there was a wait more than was promised!! Hand down if your looking for something different and a burst of flavor in Ohio City this is the place. I'm a big fan.

Went looking for an authentic Irish Pub and found it. Morgan is "The Man." He fixes drinks and entertains everyone is one fell swoop. He's a gentleman to the ladies and a gives the guys a good smack down. Next time I'm in Cleveland, I will visit again.

I went on a Friday afternoon, why did I do that?! I waited 30-40 min for my food. I got the fried fish. It was good and authentic but I don't think its worth the wait. Next time I'll do like most people there and order ahead!!

This is one of my favorite food spots in the city!  The food is great, cheap And authentic. It's genuinely a hole-in-the-wall. It's not meant to be a fancy eat-in-spot. I always get it to-go and I have fed 2 ppl into 'itis' for $15. I usually get a mix of papusa, tacos and tamales. 

Their tres leches is decent (per a friend, I don't eat pastries)

My review is pretty much the same as Karyn's below. Between two of us, we got the fried fish dish (tilapia), two pupusas (the one with pork rinds and the other with the cheese and herbs), and two tacos (pastor and beef tongue). It was a little over $20 for all that I believe. I'll start with....holy smokes that was so much food. The tilapia dish alone is enough for 1.5-2 people. The pupusas are cheap but super filling as they're stuffed.

The tilapia dish was good, didn't have a fishy smell. But like Karyn said, a little too salty. You need to eat it with the rice provided. Good crisp level without being over burnt. The papusas were really good, star of the meal IMO. The one with pork rinds was really good, the other not as much. Tacos were pretty good too. I've had better al pastor tacos, but the beef tongue was quite good and not something I see in many Hispanic restaurants.

We went on a Sunday,on which they have a beef soup special. To be honest, it didn't look that good, but perhaps it tastes very good as most people seemed to have gotten that while we were there.

Lastly, the place is very authentic, from Spanish only speaking cashiers to the clientele. If you're expected some super clean place, you'll be disappointed. The place is gritty and looks like a home kitchen in the back.

Pupusas here are awesome. When you step up to the counter to order, they give you a checklist of the menu, similar to that of Happy Dog, with more options than just tubes of meat and toppings. One list is in Spanish. If you cannot understand, ask for the English. The staff does not speak English. This makes the dining experience even better. The service is more like that of a fast food restaurant. After turning in the checklist, you sit and wait. It did take a while to get the food. El Salvadorian food is very good. Get some pupusa! This is a must visit restaurant to try out some authentic food from El Salvador!
Food is just amazing ,everything is so delicious.The place is really simple but the food is just incredible.if you are looking for a authentic Central American food this is the right place to eat.

Delicioso!!  That just about sums up this place. I had it on my restaurant bucket list for the last two years and I should encourage you to not make the same mistake I did.  If you wait more than a couple weeks to go try some ridonculously delicious pupusas then, well, that's two weeks less of pupusas in your life.

Price:  All of the appetizers are ~$2, that's dang cheap.  My wife and I had 2 pupusas, 2 tacos, 2 tamales, and 2 horchatas for $17.  The regular dishes are still pretty cheap but we've yet to try them.

Food:  The pupusas are where it's at. The tamales weren't that great but tacos were awesome.  I can't wait to go try the rest of the menu.

Overall, I loved this place.  You probably need to speak Spanish to avoid any problems during your visit but I would imagine that pointing to the menu will get you by just fine if you have no questions or problems. 

It is a small little place with just a few staff and I love how authentic it is.  I plan on returning very soon.

Mexican food in Cleveland may be garbage, but there is a least some really good Latin American food to be found.

The wife and I were on the west side and decided to give this place a try based on the reviews.  We are pretty big pupusa fans.  You can almost tell right away that this place. is the real deal based on a number of important factors: crappy stripmall location, non English speaking staff, uncomfortable unairconditioned environment, tables from different sets 20+ years old and a glass case full of very random crap for sale.  When it comes to authentic Latin food these are musts.

The pupusas here are large and delicious.  The fried plantains are a must have side.  The food is ordered sushi style with an order form with check boxes for items.  I definitely want to come back and try some of the entrees.  The only slight negative is that the horchata wasn't the best.  It was warm and tasted like that cheap mix you findin Mexican grocery stores... which it may well have been.  Best to stick to a nice Mexican coke.

If yout want to try actual authentic food and not Americanized bastardizations then please give this place a try.

Excellent pupusas! The place definitely has authentic Salvadoran style and made food as good as what I've had in El Salavador. The pupusas a huge - 2 is easily a meal with some fried plantains on the side. The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get - the two of us ate for under $15! This isn't some place you go for a classy evening, but the quality of food definitely surpassed my expectations.
The only alcohol I saw was sangria in what looked like beer bottles - I'll have to give that a try that next time.

Hole in the wall in a shady looking area ... will leave you smelling like fried food ... but the food is awesome!  You pay hole in the wall prices for authentic scratch cooking from El Salvador (I believe) ... pupusas are these great meat or cheese filled pan-fried 'pancakes' eaten with a refreshing salsa and spicy slaw.  We also get the steak tacos and fried plantains every time we go. 

We once ventured into the plates but both the chicken and fried pork belly entrees were way too dry for our liking - so we're sticking with the pupusas, tacos and plantains for future trips. 

Beware - limited English here, but that's fine because you place your order from paper menu order forms.

You have to communicate in whatever Spanish that you might know or point to the menu really well. I've been here twice now and I've been satisfied each time. On weekends, this little hole in the wall is quite full. It doesn't really focus too much on setting (some might be turned off by it) and the patrons are mostly Hispanic - all good indicators of its authenticity. 

Food: while the pupusas are not listed in main entrees, a couple of those can be quite filling. This was my first time trying them and they were delicious. The coleslaw and tomato-y sauce balanced well with it. The beef tongue taco also stood out to me. I've had the fried tilapia dish and while it's good, it was a tad salty. I would stick to the smaller dishes that they're known for.

Authentic and delicious.  Tamales wrapped in banana leaves, fantastic tacos, very flavorful refried beans.  And the pupusas are amazingly delicious.  They come with a spicy vinegar based cole slaw.  It just all works together.  The restaurant has a very small dining room and it is very casual.  There is an open kitchen so you can watch how they prepare some of the food.  They use fresh ingredients. One of the best authentic restaurants in the city.
